title: Textile, 1962–63
medium:
Medium: man-made fibers
Technique: Plain weave with supplementary wefts. One weft (the shiny one) floats from face to face to create the pattern. Second weft is in a twill interlacing. The long ends which protrude from this weft form the fringe.
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 197 x 98.5 cm (6 ft. 5 9/16 in. x 38 3/4 in.)
Repeat H: 14 cm (5 1/2 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Marion K. Morgan and from General Acquisitions Endowment, Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, and Eleanor G. Hewitt Funds
description: All black fabric which contrasts transparent areas with shiny areas with areas of long fringe. Meant as a couture dress fabric.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1962–63. Medium: man-made fibers
Technique: Plain weave with supplementary wefts. One weft (the shiny one) floats from face to face to create the pattern. Second weft is in a twill interlacing. The long ends which protrude from this weft form the fringe.. Museum purchase through gift of Marion K. Morgan and from General Acquisitions Endowment, Sarah Cooper-Hewitt, and Eleanor G. Hewitt Funds. 1991-90-7.
